[SPELLING]: "bear" instead of "born" in "was bear at Lyons"
[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing (e.g., overly complex sentence structures)

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from personal biography to broader art historical context

[GRAMMAR]: Subject-verb agreement error ("he have") in "But, on the other hand, he have an entire series to made for an edition..."
[LEXICON]: Unconventional phrasing ("half-task") in "acquitted himself brilliantly of this half-task"
[SYNTAX]: Overly complex punctuation (repeated dashes) in "entrusted him to begin with,--with just one..."

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Louvre visits to decorating fans without clear connection
[STRUCTURE]: Detour into detailed vignette descriptions disrupts narrative flow
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous timeline ("later on," "in after years") without explicit context

[GRAMMAR]: Typo ("take" instead of "taken") in "material dimensions in works of art are not take into consideration."
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "The scenes which he kindles into life... was like stories told in an intimate sort of way").

[TRANSITION]: Slightly abrupt shift from biographical/artistic details to thematic analysis of painting size.
[STRUCTURE]: Unintroduced quote from Gustave Larroumet disrupts flow momentarily.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., lengthy descriptive passages)

[TRANSITION]: Slight abruptness between biographical narrative and extended critical quotes
[STRUCTURE]: Minor tangents (e.g., "One can never grow tired of quoting Gautier...")

[GRAMMAR]: Subject-verb agreement error ("as I is aware")
Verb tense consistency error ("You can understood")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift into quoted anecdote without clear contextual lead-in

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between biographical narrative, artistic critique, and thematic reflections (e.g., from war service to color criticism).

[LEXICON]: Informal phrasing ("in spite of all this")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from costume collection to linen research
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disconnect between anecdotal examples and thematic statements
